title: Bug 12398 Accessibility problems
description: When using the software, I need to first click on one of the 'live' areas before it starts working (e.g., the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame).
OB: After launching the Help view on March 26, 2002, in Windows 2000, the tab key is unresponsive and does not perform any action.
EB: When I launch the Help view, I expect the tab key to navigate through the interactive elements or links within the Help view without the need to click on a specific area first.
SR:
1. Open the software on a Windows 2000 machine.
2. Go to the Help view.
3. Attempt to navigate through the Help view using the tab key.
4. Observe that the tab key does not work as expected and does not navigate to the interactive elements.
